35143448.review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th][b]CATEGORY[/b][/th]
        [th][b]RANK[/b][/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][/td]
        [td][/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][b]VIDEO[/b]

[i]graphics, performance, port, physics, arts, visuals...[/i]
[/td]
        [td][b]6/10[/b]

Cute and indie, yet a bit clumsy, so nothing great. The graphics are just "average and pleasant", it could become a 7 it if was less casual, because after all it feels close to retro Sega or PS1 games... but in casual.
[/td]
    [/tr]
 [tr]
        [td][b]AUDIO[/b]

[i]music, sound effects, voice-over, audio balance, subtitles...[/i]
[/td]
        [td][b]6/10[/b]

Very casual, nothing fancy or catchy. I have absolutely no recollection of it, so, yes, it felt casual and common.
[/td]
    [/tr]
 [tr]
        [td][b]PLAY[/b]

[i]controls, difficulty, level design, luck-strategy-skill balance...[/i]
[/td]
        [td][b]8/10[/b]

That is where the game shines the most: a unique gameplay, very addictive, oldschool-orientated and so hardcore! The difficulty is usually perfectly dosed (the beginning is easy and tutorial-ish, yet the more you go on the more you will take hours to finish ONE level...) for most levels, and finishing the game or "really finishing" the game are 2 different things!
[/td]
    [/tr]
 [tr]
        [td][b]CONTENT[/b]

[i]story, world, solo immersion, multiplayer depth, overall idea...[/i]
[/td]
        [td][b]6/10[/b]

The world is indeed a bit odd, but nothing memorable. You pilot a little spaceship, throughout many levels and worlds, but no background whatsoever.
[/td]
    [/tr]
 [tr]
        [td][b]OTHER[/b]

[i]length, replayability, price, community, economics, devs...[/i]
[/td]
        [td][b]8/10[/b]

Great length (numerous worlds and levels) and replayability (you will WANT to find every secret level, and collect everything like in classic gaming! I would not be surprised to learn the developers are in their 30s because that is how that game feels like: a "classic arcade 101% finish!" game.
[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][/td]
        [td][/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][b]TOTAL[/b]

[i]Average sum with a secret formula to adjust nuances...[/i]
[/td]
        [td][b]75% - very good![/b]

Overall a great indie game, with a sweet oldschool style, reminiscent of the nineties and the arcade style. Perfect for retro gamers and for lonely rainy sundays! If you can close your eyes on many little casual flaws and average development aspects, and if you enjoy the classic arcade style, this game is for you. For me it was a very nice surprise and I still have not finished it, I savour it! I am looking forward to future games from this studio, ALTHOUGH their next one, SnakeBird, was not very interesting for me when I tried it on smartphone... but they have talent!
[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[b]Disclaimer[/b]: [i]do NOT pay attention to my game time, I used to play that game when I changed flat and was without internet for weeks! So I spent many more hours on it but offline.[/i]

22182660.review:
Credo che molti ce l'avranno, era tipo in qualche bundle mesi/anni fa, ma è uno di quei titoli che si vedono nella libreria ma a cui poi di solito non si gioca mai. 
Beh, fatelo, merita.
La trama, vabbè, è un pretesto per infilarci un boss finale.
Ma è un gioco sostanzialmente molto semplice. Con le frecce si muove la navetta, e con un pulsante si frena. Fine. 
Il resto (la velocità, le planate, i rimbalzi, eccetera) è dato tutto dalla fisica, e dai numerosi strumenti messi nei vari livelli, che hanno una curva di difficoltà ben bilanciata e non risultano quasi mai banali, complici varie trovate (chiavi, interruttori, portali) che di volta in volta li rendono originali.
Ha però due difetti da menzionare:

- il sistema di controllo in generale è buono, ma diverse volte la navetta va un po' per conto suo, specialmente nei livelli in cui si cambia la gravità (e i controlli tipo si invertono) o in quelli (tantissimi) in cui bisogna prendere velocità per raggiungere aree lontane. Ecco, provare a controllare una navetta che viaggia a 300 km/h è un casino. Sì, poi ci si prende un po' la mano, ma non sono rare le volte in cui comunque si sbatte addosso a un qualche pixel, costringendo a rifare. 
- alcuni dei livelli più avanzati hanno elementi (palle, soprattutto) da far rimbalzare/rotolare andandoci addosso con la navetta e robe simili, il che va anche bene, peccato che però spesso le palle vadano dove vogliono loro (e qui vi lascio ai doppi sensi). Ok, seguono sempre la fisica ben fatta del gioco, ma la sensazione di avere poco controllo su questi elementi è alta, e a volte potrebbe risultare noioso. Fortunatamente i livelli così sono pochi.

Per il resto, il grado di sfida è buono, ci sono tanti segreti da scoprire e livelli extra che non sfigurerebbero in Super Meat Boy in quanto a madonne tirate giù. Il gioco in sè dura anche abbastanza, specialmente se si vuole sbloccare tutto, perciò se cercate un titolo all'apparenza semplice ma coinvolgente e quasi sempre ben realizzato, non posso che consigliarvelo.

16953230.review: buggy piece of garbage. it looked fun, but crashed constantly- would only run in 1024x768 in windowed mode (and that's after I deleted a config file just to get the game to run in the first place), and then it's stuck in "demo mode". Found a thread from 2011 where somebody ran into the same situation and the solution was to shut down steam and delete one of *steams* files (not the game's files). I backed the file up and tried it, didn't work. This game has been out long enough for crap like this to be completely inexcusable. If you see this on sale like I did, save yourself the headache, or at the very least try it within the refund period to make sure it works!! I didn't realize there was only a 14 day window for refunds, so here I am on the 18th day finally getting a chance to play it and now I'm stuck with it.

16070706.review: Nimbus is a glider game.  You don't have an engine, your engine is gravity, and special platforms within the game like bumpers, speed ups or other graviational devices.  The game starts off real easy, but it gets tremendously difficult.  This is not a game for the faint of heart, neither are the achievements.  This is one of the most difficult games I've ever played.  However, the devs did a really good job of programming the physics and of desiging the levels.  Pick this up if you're up for a challenge.

12241026.review:
Colourful, accessible arcade action puzzle game where you manage thrust and inertia to steer your little spaceship thing through a gravity-shifting crazy golf obstacle course to the exit tile. Of course there are optional extra collectables along the way, alternate exits to alternate worlds, Super Mario World style, and enough new hazards and abilities to contend with that it kept my interest long before I ran out of new levels.

Works really well as a casual pass-the-pad multiplayer game. It's a lot more forgiving than something like Super Hexagon. Nobody's going to be on for too long but nobody's getting an early bath after five seconds. Well... not often.

Feels very much like a game you might find stuffed in a corner in a seaside arcade or find on an Amiga disk with half a Chinese label on it - you'll want to tell people about it, when you remember, but most of them will almost certainly never play it and you're not sure of the name or where you played it.

Maybe you should stop smoking weed.

11841761.review: Great game, simple idea, easy to pick up, but can be tricky to beat. Great soundtrack too.

11811801.review: Nimbus is the kind of game you play obsessively to beat your best time, the sort that satisfies the soul of a speed-runner; yet it has a satisfying serenity to it all, too. 11386115.review:
I would call it a puzzle platformer, except there is no platforming involved because you can fly. However, it is a puzzle game that involves skill similar to platforming. 
The game looks cute and relaxing, but is anything but. One of the hardest games I have ever played (I haven't play dark souls though). If you like repeating one bit over and over again to get a better time to repeat another level to get a better time ad infinitum to attempt to get one of the top global averages you will probably love this game. 
Only lacks one thing, and that is a custom level creator that is integrated with the Steam workshop. This isn't bad though as there is plenty of hard levels to play after the main story is beaten. If you are worried about not much content don't be.

10602655.review:
Absolutely lovable and earworm-worthy synth music; bright, effective and personal graphics, and instantly-easy-to-learn but absolutely-impossible-to-master mechanics.

Gather this with a fast flow (when you die you reappear on the beginning instantly, and there are no lives or continues), a pretty well crafted difficulty curve (when the hard levels begin appearing, you know you're in for easily one of the toughest challenges in videogames, think super meat boy but more) and just in case someone likes that, global rankings and steam friends rankings.

9204143.review:
Nimbus is an almost perfeect game. The sense of momentum and the feeling of zipping through the air is really fun. Shooting out of cannons, bouncing off of launch pads, diving from great heighs; it all feels good. The game introduces new mechanics, level features and techniques steadily throughout the game, so it's never stale. The music is great, and suits the relaxing and exhilarating aspects of the game very well. Collecting the coins and completing the scrapyard stages after finishing the main game is also very rewarding and satisfying. The graphics/art style are also superb.

Only problem I had with the game was that the boss battle felt a bit out of place, turning the game from acrobatic/racing game into bullet hell for the last level.

The difficulty goes from very casual to extremely challenging gradually enough to never be off-putting. This makes the game great for a quick bit of light diversion and fun. However, the completionists among us can also enjoy the optional time attacks and gold-collection features for some extra challenge.

8207911.review:
This is one of my favorite indie games!
You control this flying ship which speeds up when you fly downwards and slows down when you fly upwards. So you have to use momentum and your surroundings (like cannons and bouncy platforms) to your advantage. It feels really nice to glide through the levels with your ship.
Now let's get to where the game really shines: [b]It has the most excellent level design[/b]. Almost every level has multiple ways to beat it and there's a lot of hidden trophies. The levels are pretty varied, some are like puzzle where you have to find the right order to push blocks and unlock switches, others are about finger dexterity, where you navigate your ship through narrow corridors and evade moving hazards.
I also loved the speedrunning aspect of the game, every level has a highscore table where it shows you how fast you were compared to everybody else. I made it my goal to get into the top 1000 of every level and I had a lot of fun figuring out the fastest way to beat each level.

7988841.review:
Whatever you may say about this game, I for one consider this a game to swear by... no wait, I meant at. This is a game to swear *at*, repeatedly and profusely as your fingers grow numb and your eyes become bloodshot.

This is a game about cutesy momentum-propelled sentient spaceships, where gasoline does not exist and you must rely on cannons and bouncing pads and other assorted devices to keep your spaceship avatar afloat. Though the the graphics are lighthearted, the game itself is a cruel stern mistress, demanding more and more of your fine motor controls and keen reflexes. In later stages, just one degree of rotation or one millisecond of hesistation can mean the difference between glorious victory and ignoble destruction.

Fortunately, this game has an easy mode, so beginners can have checkpoints and unlimited times to retry a stage and hit the goal. On the other hand, this game features normal and hard modes as well, for the player who demands maddening challenges to triumph over. The game's levels are actually short, and the game can be finished within a day, assuming you finish all the stages in one go. But if you enjoy unforgiving games and testing yourself to beat momentum puzzles as fast and as perfectly as you can, then definitely give this game a go!

7964324.review: I strange, surreal game that'll make you say "GODDAMNIT! AGAIN! I'LL GET THIS EVENTUALLY!"

7881998.review:

7816308.review: Watched a guy speedrun this game on SummerGamesDoneQuick2013 and it looked super fun to play and it really is. An fing delight. :D

7748378.review:
Nimbus is a lot of fun and very pretty, and it's basically just as challenging as you want it to be. There are a lot of optional levels, you can configure how you want the checkpoints to work, and your time records don't unlock any content or anything so it doesn't matter if you don't care about trying to accomplish them.

However...

If you _are_ interested in time records, be aware that Nimbus has one enormous bug: it bases its records on how much time elapses in the real world between the beginning and the end of the level, rather than how many game ticks pass in that time. So depending on how powerful your computer is, falling through the same vertical space without pressing any keys may take you anywhere from 4 seconds to 30 or more. Lowering your resolution and turning off graphical effects can help with this on some of the levels, but these are not adjustments you should be forced to make to fix a gameplay issue.

395644.review:
tl;dr: A gravity-propelled spaceship meets Super Meat Boy-like challenges.

Nimbus is no doubt one of the most tragically overlooked indie games on Steam. You're a little spaceship trying to navigate charmingly rendered 2D-levels to reach the goal (and if you like, find the cleverly hidden coins). There's only one problem: your ship has no method of propulsion. Instead you'll have to make use of sparingly placed cannons (which also serve as limited-use checkpoints) to gain momentum and propel yourself around the stages. This is a game to return to again and again, with tons of content to experience even after you defeat the last boss.

2289051.review:
操作が独特なレースパズル。
左右への旋回とブレーキを用いてロケットを操作する。
跳ね返り板や加速パネルで機体がどんどん速くなる。
機体を反転させることも多く、操作に混乱することもしばしば。
面白い仕掛けが多く、楽しめるステージが多い。
コースを誰よりも速く走り抜けたいタイムアタック好きにオススメ。

Time-trial très sympathique, on se surprend vite à y retourner pour améliorer son temps car vraiment, cette 553ème place sur le Leaderboard mondial, c'est pas possible, faut améliorer ça.

157130.review: Decent game. The fun gameplay you'd expect from an addictive Flash game combined with some nice visuals. Main campaign will take you about 2 hours to beat, but the replay value in the levels is trying to get the hidden coins. I'd give it a 7/10. Try to grab it for $5 or less.

184359.review: Strangely addictive gameplay, relaxing music, and challenging puzzles. Also a good opportunity to get your controller out.

1747125.review:
Simple: A+, only 4 buttons, left right brakes and reset, Goal: get from A to B.

Casual: A, I can turn this game on at any time to decompress, however there are some levels that just shouldn't be attempted if you have high blood pressure problems.

Difficulty Scale: C, they mark each level with a difficulty from 1-10, I find those markings somewhat arbitrary, you can accidentally stumble across hidden levels with low difficulty only to find them much harder than stated. *SPOILERS -->* the final level throws such a curveball at you it can only be compared to the final level of Trine.  It isn't necessisarily difficult per say, but its a massive shift in the pace of the game.

Replay value: B, you can easily get some of the bonus unlocks your first play through, the bonus tokens are very simple in the early levels, and the unlockable cosmetic modifications to your ship are fun, but it isn't going to bring you back if you aren't into that kind of thing.

ran out of room
summary 9/10mustown

1451317.review:
Numbus is based around these core tenants

1) You are a little glider, and you want to go fast.
2) "Whippersnapper! Even if I put some boost plates on the level, you couldn't handle the speed!"
3) Woah, this is the highest ratio of normal to hidden levels I've seen since Super Mario World! And they're all really, really hard!
4) Spikes! Spikes spikes spikes! Too fast! Too fast!

I enjoyed it.

288919.review:
A really interesting gameplay mechanic is employed in this game:
Your ship can not fly, but only glide. You must use the environment to travel & complete the level/puzzle.

Can get incredibly hard, but overall the game is excellent.

169549.review:
This game is not bad, but it was also not all that good either in my opinion.  The basic idea is that you are a weighted object that needs to get the to the exit: always being pulling to the ground you must hit bouncing walls, cannons, ect to keep you moving.  Later they introduce reverse gravity, gravity bubbles, and teleports.

Overall it is not bad: It fits in line with Super Meat Boy and Bit Trip runner as you just play random 2D levels attempting to get to the goal. They all have frustrating levels and spikes love to kill you.... however it is not as fun as Super Meat Boy or Bit Trip runner.

I beat it in about 3-4 hours, but I skipped extra levels and DLC levels.  Just didn't enjoy it that much... as a side note - I beat the last boss but didn't get the beating the game acheivement. Maybe I did it wrong? lol.

One of the best indie games I've even played, very challenging, extremely fun!

726734.review: Are you gravely aware of your own mortality? Perhaps the soothing ease & relaxation that only Nimbus can provide will help alleviate your woes.

1445606.review: Moderately brutal but extremely clever, Nimbus is a game about flying a glider through a bunch of physics puzzles.  Definitely takes some getting used to, and it's kind of short if you manage to blast through it, but the play was unique for an action game and it all worked very well for me.

1425585.review: Woah, this game is really fun! I wasn't sure what to think of the game from the description, but after playing, I love it! It's a kind of puzzle/platformer, and it's great to be able to keep practicing to get faster and compare to everyone else!

2850546.review:
This has to be one of the most fun indy games I have ever played. I got it as a part of an indy bundle.  This is worth any price ever. Basically this game has paper plane physics. You are constantly falling. Only gaining altitude from power-ups, wind gusts, ect. This has been called a puzzle game, but I never felt like I had to "solve" anything. Everything made sense and was a joy to play. I love this game. I LOVE this game. Woody said it best in toy story! "This isn't flying! This is falling! With style!" ~woody 

You will love this game. It is a MUST HAVE. ~PR0XIDIAN

832751.review: Um indie muito bem feito. Bom gameplay, bons gráficos, boa jogabilidade, bem otimizado, bons mapas. Oferece um bom desafio: é daqueles jogos que, em algumas fases, você tem que insistir para conseguir passar

1438318.review:
I know a lot of people have played Super Meat Boy and loved it. I also know that many people have not even heard of Nimbus. Do yourself a favor. Check it out.

If you liked Super Meat Boy, then you should like Nimbus. It's in the same category of game, in that it's an action platformer with puzzle-y elements.

It differs from Meat Boy in that you have to keep up momentum. Generally this means that, while you can slow down in Meat Boy, you can't here. There are easier levels and harder levels (and impossible ones), and I've found that I get the same sort of satisfaction from beating a level in Nimbus that I did in Super Meat Boy.

I don't want to compare the two games too much, because there are a couple giant differences. The momentum thing is one. Another is it's a fair bit more puzzle-y and less twitch gameplay. Also, I really like the art style. The 2.5D cutesy affair really remind me of Yoshi's Story, which is another game worth playing.

Check it out. Hopefully you'll like it.

2381642.review: Nimbus is a fun little time-killer that'll get the blood pumping for any time trial enthusiasts. It's easy to pick up, but difficult to master, especially when it comes to the various objects that populate the levels.

4457697.review: 1/10. Game blows. Ignoring the questionable game design, the main premise of this game is to challenge the player with awkward controls. Both in game and out of game (settings). For example, configuring the gamepad is not intuitive--how do you delete a mis-binding to multiple keys?--and no in game keyboard remapping. Stupid! Fortunately, I didn't pay very much for this game, but it was too much. I may revisist this title to give it a second chance, but doubt it. RGH

5074219.review: Cool little puzzle game. Interesting gimmick, pleasant music, nice graphics that serve their purporse.

1248509.review: While Steam calls it a racing game, I'd say Nimbus is more of a puzzle game. Your ship simply falls and must conserve momentum and use elements of the levels to propel itself. Most levels involve using switches and pushing various objects around to reach the goal. A very fun game, although priced a bit high at $9.99. Pick it up while it's on sale.

2936737.review: Erinnert etwas an ein Jump'n'Run, ist aber eigentlich was ganz anderes. Man fliegt mit einem Schiff durch die Gegend und wird von der Schwerkraft angezogen. Die kann in späteren Levels auch mal umgekehrt sein. Mit Schwung muss man unterschiedliche Aufgaben lösen. Das Spiel hat abwechslungreiche Rätsel und ist meistens fair. 1307874.review: Man this game is amazing! I made it so I should know!

350357.review: Outstanding puzzle game.  It's all about momentum and guiding your ship through mazes.  Lose momentum and start over!  Challenging and rewarding.  Outdo your best times with enabling the GHOST ship.  HUGE update out soon.

485045.review:
I am a bit torn between love and hate with this game. 
For a perfectionist like i am, its a bit of a nightmare, because some of the levels are really tricky and hard to master (to get all the gold coins you can collect). 
The good thing is, you dont have to do that if you dont want it =)
You can also try to get the best time, on online leaderboards too, so there is a time factor in the game, but it can be also ignored if you dont care about that.

The game works flawlessy on my machine. The visuals are pretty and fitting altough not groundbreaking, i really like the different ship designs and effects you can unlock. Also there are sometimes different paths you can take to get to different alternative levels.
The controls took me a little while to get used to them, but when you do, its fine. 

For the asking price this is a fair deal, you get plenty of playtime for the money.
Overall i think you might like this game if you enjoy a challenge, because it is really challenging later on =)

118844.review: Some of the best level design of any game I've ever seen. Subtly changing strategy can swing the difficulty massively. Movement of obstacles in the level is very finely timed to allow for fast solutions, as well as being friendly to those who want to progress at a more leisurely pace.

406461.review: Excellent game with good, colorful graphics, music and level design. Worth the low price ^_^

473488.review: Love this game. Not too hard to beat the game, a little challenging to get all the coins and utterly frustrating to get all the speed runs. It's perfect.

3541576.review:
Nimbus is easily one of the greatest games I've ever played, and certainly the only one I still want to replay.
Because Nimbus is all about friction - all about the mechanics of flight and soaring. Playing Nimbus is like riding a rollercoaster in 3D, without rails. It's like reaching your arm under your sofa to grab that single nickel with the tip of your nails. Nimbus doesn't have a physics engine - it has a HOPE engine. Your ship moves by the sheer force of your faith, trying to climb the ever-unsurmountable heights to get to the finish line.
Nimbus rewards daring, creative players.

Ah, and also it has a kickass soundtrack.

EDIT: Stil pretty good come on Steam gimme mah badge

2101612.review:
Awesome little game, which I highly rate.

Your objective is to guide your ship to the end, but it has no propulsion of its own, meaning you must use gravity, and various methods of acceleration via interaction with other objects, to get there.

The game manages to be challenging, without being frustrating, for the most part. Another layer of gameplay lies in the timer it gives you, allowing you to attempt to get the best time for the level for leaderboard comparison. However, any in-level checkpoints don't pull back your timer, so the level will usually have to be completed in one life for a decent time, making some levels really difficult.

With lots of second exits which lead to secret levels, the volume of content is huge for an indie game. Yet to complete it, but I imagine I still have hours of playtime left. With some attempting to improve your level times, I can see this game going for 15-20 hours of playtime, more if you enjoy really pushing yourself.

3488.review: Really interesting and original physics puzzler platformer. There's a lot of fun and difficulty that comes from having to use the environment to generate propulsion.

2802515.review: Actully really really good. Lots of pretty damm well designed levels, I holeheartedly indorese this event and or product!

43441.review:
You. You buy this game. Right goddamn now.

Lovely visuals, incredible upbeat soundtrack, and some of the best physics-bouncing, time-trialing you've ever had.

3949373.review:
Fun, frustrating, clever game.

Nimbus sorta plays like a combination of Super Meat Boy, Sonic, and that paper airplane game for your calculator. There are parts where you have to dodge and weave through fields of spikes and projectiles. There are also parts where you have to puzzle your way though mazes, trying to build up enough momentum to get to that just out of reach spot. Expect a lot of aha moments and a lot of times where you want to punch your computer out of frustration.

I would recommend this game if you can take a game that doesn't pull any punches.

2018211.review: Awesome Indie game. Difficult yet rewarding.

247806.review: Really loving this game!  It's pretty original (you're basically an unpowered glider that relies on bounce pads, etc. for propulsion), but I found the controls and gameplay to be immediately intuitive.  And the difficulty is just right.

1611117.review: Great indie game. Reminds me of sonic the hedgehog with it's asthetic. however it is nothing like sonic at all. Kind of like gliding an paper plane though a ton of interesting puzzles. Chances are you havn't playyed anything like it before. I loved it and have played though it at least twice. Very fun up beat music. great cartoony visuals. Cosmetic unlocks. Classic mario style overworld. Challanging but fair.

668200.review: Clever and beautifully made; full of variety in level design, pacing, and difficulty. It's like an impossible cross between Super Mario World, VVVVVV, Snake Rattle & Roll, Gods, and Altitude. 1092823.review:
This game will make you your bitch. In a good way. Basically, you guide a ship which can't control itself. You gain momentum, hit bounce pads, shoot out of cannons, avoid spikes, hit switches and all that jazz. It controls just fine and is not at all frustrating because of that. Some the levels (specifically, about half to 2/3s of the way through) are fucking long and you need to commit 'em to muscle memory. There are checkpoints if you play on easy or normal (pussies) but hardcore dudes like me and Strudel will play on Hard all the way through.

If your liable to get frustrated by this kind of game then probably wait until it goes on sale. There's a demo coming soon so try it whenever it's out.
